Mayor & City Council Members


Omar Ochoa
Mayor
mayorochoa@cityofedinburg.com

Omar Ochoa is the Mayor of Edinburg, Texas, elected in November 2025 to lead the
city's next era of progress and growth. A native of Edinburg, he is committed to a clear vision focused on economic expansion, securing long-term infrastructure expansion, and ensuring governmental accountability and transparency. Before his election, he served as the Edinburg City Attorney for nearly six years, where he was the chief legal advisor to the City Council, the City Manager, and all City Departments. Mayor Ochoa brings a distinguished professional background to his role, including being a nationally recognized trial lawyer, a Certified Public Accountant (CPA), a former federal law clerk, and the first Latino Editor in Chief of the Texas Law Review at UT Law. He is dedicated to using his legal and financial expertise to strengthen Edinburg’s infrastructure and attract high-quality jobs for the community.

David Salazar Jr. Mayor Pro Tem 956-388-8207 davidsalazar@cityofedinburg.com Councilmember David D. Salazar, Jr. was elected to office in 2023. Born in McAllen, Texas, Salazar attended the University of Texas – San Antonio and returned to the Rio Grande Valley in 2004. Salazar established himself as a professional loan officer and executive in the mortgage and insurance industries. Salazar started his own small business and insurance firm, Silverhorn Insurance Agency, LLC, in Edinburg in 2010. Salazar’s business has been serving the Edinburg community for thirteen years. Salazar has a wealth of experience in finance and management, overseeing and analyzing agency financial data, evaluating coverage and risks, and designing growth strategies to maximize opportunities for clients. As councilmember, Salazar will utilize this knowledge and expertise to provide responsible financial oversight and management of taxpayer dollars and the city’s finances while providing the highest-quality city services to Edinburg families. Salazar is married to Lyra Vela-Salazar of Edinburg. Together they have three children: David Rene Salazar III, Sierra Camille Salazar and Selah Eliana Salazar. The family is active with various organizations, including Starlite 4-H in Edinburg and supporting multiple athletic clubs and teams. Salazar is an active and contributing member of the Edinburg community and currently serves on the Airport Advisory Board for South Texas International Airport and on the Financial Board of Sacred Heart Catholic Church of Edinburg.

Daniel 'Dan' Diaz
Councilmember Place 1
956-388-8207
dandiaz@cityofedinburg.com

Daniel “Dan” Diaz was born in Harlingen, TX and first moved to Edinburg in 1991 after being honorably discharged from the military. He is a combat veteran, a business owner, a Licensed Paramedic and an Emergency Room RN.

Dan served in the United States Army as a 91A, Combat Medical Specialist.  He was stationed with the 1 st Infantry Division and was deployed to the Middle East where he served in combat operations during Desert Shield and Desert Storm.  He was awarded several military commendations, including the Combat Medical Badge, which is awarded to medics who deploy into an active combat zone.

He has been a Licensed Paramedic in the State of Texas for over 25 years and has been the business owner of MTS Emergency Medical Services for over 20 years.  He also became a Registered Nurse and has been working at a local Trauma Center for over 6 years.  After 5 years of being a charge nurse, he was appointed as a member of the Peer Review Board for Nurses. He was on the Board of Directors of the Texas Ambulance Association for a number of years and has participated in state initiatives in order to help shape legislation for the EMS industry.

In our local community, Dan has also volunteered as a coach for over a decade with the Edinburg Parks and Recreation Department coaching baseball, basketball and soccer.  He served on the City of Edinburg Medical Advisory Board, the Edinburg Parks and Recreation Board, and the Edinburg Economic Development Council where he was elected Secretary.  He’s a proud parent volunteer and scout dad with the Edinburg Cub Scouts Pack 500.  Recently, he was asked to serve with the End of Watch Relief Organization Board of Directors, a Non-profit organization which provides monetary assistance to the families of frontline workers who lost their life on duty.

Dan built a home in Edinburg in 2004 and married Brenda Renteria Diaz who is also a Health Care Professional and a local Speech Pathologist.  They have a 10-year-old baptized at the Holy Family Catholic Church.  Diaz was elected to the Edinburg City Council Place 1 in 2021.

Jason De Leon
Councilmember Place 2 956-388-8207
jasondeleon@cityofedinburg.com

Jason De Leon was raised in Mission and graduated from Mission Veterans High School in 2006. He obtained his Bachelor of Business Administration Degree from Lindenwood University in Saint Charles, Missouri, and an Associate of Applied Science Degree from Commonwealth Institute of Funeral Service in Houston. Upon graduation, he worked as a Funeral Director at Memorial Funeral Home in San Juan and Edinburg. He is a graduate of Leadership Edinburg Class 23 and was an Ambassador with the Edinburg Chamber of Commerce. He currently serves as a member of the Zoning Board of Adjustment for the City of Edinburg and is a Loan Originator with Willow Bend Mortgage. De Leon was elected to the Edinburg City Council Place 2 in 2021.


Gerardo "Gerry" Lozano
Councilmember Place 4
956-388-8207
glozano@cityofedinburg.com

Gerardo “Gerry” Lozano proudly serves as the Edinburg City Councilmember for Place 4. A lifelong Edinburg resident and proud product of the Edinburg school district, Lozano remains deeply rooted in the community that helped shape his values and work ethic. He is a devoted father to three children—Amaris, Jarred, and Haily—and is happily engaged to his best friend, Zabrina Mettlach.

Lozano’s entrepreneurial spirit was cultivated early on through years of hands-on experience working alongside his father in the family’s produce business, specializing in year-round watermelon growing and shipping. Today, he is the owner of NUTX Construction, a company known for its commitment to quality, reliability, and building a stronger future for the region. Whether in business or public service, Lozano brings dedication, heart, and a passion for progress to everything he does.
415 W University Dr. Edinburg, Texas 78539
